org.gearvrf

Class GVREyePointeeHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVREyePointeeHolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GVREyePointeeHolder
extends GVRHybridObject
    Holds any number of 'eye pointees,' which are things the eye is pointing at. Ray casting is computationally expensive. Rather than probing the entire scene graph, GVRF requires you to mark parts of the scene as "pickable" by adding their meshes (or, more cheaply if less precisely, their bounding box) to a GVREyePointeeHolder; attaching that holder to a scene object; and setting the holder's enabled flag.

    When you call one of the pickScene() overloads, you get an array of eye pointee holders. You can then call getOwnerObject() to get the scene object that a holder is attached to.

    • Method Detail

      • getEnable

        public boolean getEnable()
        Is this holder enabled? If this holder is disabled, then picking will not occur against its GVREyePointees.
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false otherwise.

      • setEnable

        public void setEnable(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable this holder. If this holder is disabled, then picking will not occur against its GVREyePointees.
        Parameters:
        enable - whether this holder should be enabled.

      • getHit

        public float[] getHit()
        Get the x, y, z of the point of where the hit occurred in model space
        Returns:

      • removePointee

        public void removePointee(GVREyePointee eyePointee)
        Remove a GVREyePointee from this holder. No exception is thrown if the eye pointee is not held by this holder.

        eyePointee - The GVREyePointee to remove

        public GVRSceneObject getOwnerObject()
